p: Previous studies have shown that genes regulated by NF-κB could play a critical role in regulating ROS levels in cells (Liu et al. 2020). RosA reduced the protein levels of p-NFκB (225.2 ± 12.7% vs. 282.9 ± 17.1%, Figure 9(A,B)) and p-IκB-α (139.3 ± 15.1% vs. 196.1 ± 20.6%, Figure 9(C,D)) following OGD/R injury in cells.
